intro: Gongronemopsis latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf gongronemopsis, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Gongronemopsis latifolia is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and fragrant blooms.
